abstract: New York City's Rent Guidelines Board votes, 7-to-2, to freeze rents on one-year leases on city's rent-stabilized apartments, unprecedented move in board's 46-year history; vote, first made by nine-member board appointed entirely by Mayor Bill de Blasio, aims to help city residents whose incomes have not kept up with steep rise in housing costs.
lead_paragraph: The move, unprecedented in the 46-year history of the Rent Guidelines Board, was the first decision on rent levels by a nine-member panel appointed in its entirety by Mayor Bill de Blasio.

headline.main: New York City Board Votes to Freeze Regulated Rents on One-Year Leases
headline.print_headline: Panel Freezes Regulated Rents In an Unprecedented Decision

snippet: The move, unprecedented in the 46-year history of the Rent Guidelines Board, was the first decision on rent levels by a nine-member panel appointed in its entirety by Mayor Bill de Blasio.
